Ram Air Turbine (RAT)

Remove Bookmark
Add Bookmark
The RAT can supply Emergency AC Power by using the Ram Air flow to drive an AC Generator.
The RAT is stowed behind the RAT bay door on the lower right side of the fuselage just before the wing.
When deployed it uses a 2 blade turbine (19 inch diameter) to drive a AC generator which is cooled by the same ram air flow.
The output of the RAT is also 115/200 Volt, 3 phases, 400 Hz with a 15 kVA rating without any time limit.
The RAT is capable to sustain this power as long as the airspeed is above 180 kts.

Plura amari petere vellent.

Hi omnes libus inter se differunt.
Nihil hic, nihil horum?
